ray.math

Class Geometry

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.math.Geometry

  • public class Geometry
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to contain static methods for various useful geometric computations.
    Author:
    srm

      • squareToPSAHemisphere

        public static void squareToPSAHemisphere(Point2 seed,
                                         Vector3 outDir)
        Parameters:
        seed - A point randomly distributed in the unit square
        outDir - A vector randomly distributed over the hemisphere wrt. proj. solid angle

      • squareToHemisphere

        public static void squareToHemisphere(Point2 seed,
                                      Vector3 outDir)
        Parameters:
        seed - A point randomly distributed in the unit square
        outDir - A vector randomly distributed over the hemisphere wrt. solid angle (area)

      • squareToSphere

        public static void squareToSphere(Point2 seed,
                                  Vector3 outDir)
        Parameters:
        seed - A point randomly distributed in the unit square
        outDir - A vector randomly distributed over the sphere wrt. solid angle (area)

      • squareToTriangle

        public static void squareToTriangle(Point2 seed,
                                    Point2 baryPt)
        Here we use a better way to sample in the triangle, because it doesn't use squre root which is computationally expensive.
        Parameters:
        seed - A point randomly distributed in the unit square
        baryPt - A 2D point randomly distributed over the triangle (0,0), (1,0), (0,1). Its coordinates are the beta and gamma barycentric coordinates for an arbitrary triangle.

      • squareToPolarDisc

        public static void squareToPolarDisc(Point2 seed,
                                     Point2 polarPt)
        Map from square to disc using Shirley's concentric mapping.
        Parameters:
        seed - A point randomly distributed in the unit square
        polarPt - A 2D point randomly distributed over the unit disc, in polar coordinates (polarPt.x is radius, polarPt.y is angle).

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
